input: Analyze OTP cards with respect to their password generation mechanism.
output: OTP (One-Time Password) products generate a new password each time a user logs in. This means that the password used for authentication is unique for each login session and is not static. This dynamic generation of passwords enhances security by making it more difficult for unauthorized individuals to gain access even if they manage to intercept a previous password.

input: What insights can you derive from the analysis of SecurID cards?
output: SecurID cards are a specific type of OTP product from RSA Security. These cards function as devices that display a new password to the user periodically, typically every 60 seconds. When a user needs to log into a computer system, they enter the password shown on the SecurID card when prompted by the server. The server is aware of the algorithm the SecurID card uses to generate these passwords and can verify the entered password.
